Description of incident: University of Texas at El Paso is notifying students that their Social Security numbers were visible when their tax forms were sent out. The University notified 15,000 students but they don't know exactly how many students were affected. UTEP blames a glitch in a machine used to fold letters when student’s forms were sent out. Some of the forms were folded in such a way that the document shifted on the envelope and allowed for the Social Security numbers to be visible through the mailing window on the envelope.
